trans-unit.source: In the utilities company scenario, several members of your development are familiar with using Azure CLI to manage their resources.
In order to leverage their expertise, you decide to examine how to enable CORS using the Azure CLI.
In this exercise, you'll learn how to use the Azure CLI to enable CORS for Azure storage.
Enable CORS using the Azure CLI

Run the following command in the Cloud Shell to set environment variables that you will use in later commands; these variables specify the name of Azure storage account and account key for your storage account.
Run the following command to add a CORS rule to your blob service.
Run the following command to verify that your CORS rule has been added to your blob service.
You should see a response that resembles the following JSON output.
Clear your CORS rules using the Azure CLI
Run the following command to list your existing CORS rules; you should see the rule that you added in the previous section of this exercise.
Run the following command to clear all of your CORS rules.
Run the following command to verify that your CORS rules have been removed from your blob service.
You should see an empty JSON response like the following example.
